p:
Gastrointestinal symptoms, especially diarrhea, are common in MERS‐CoV infections and occur in up to at least one‐third of patients.
122 ,
126 What has been somewhat more important in this context, however, is that asymptomatic or relatively minor infections occur in a considerable number of people who test positive with genetic amplification technologies.
127 ,
129 One review proposed that some 12% to 25% of identified MERS‐CoV infections are asymptomatic.
130 These findings also need to be couched in the context of potential test fallibility for a variety of reasons.
131
